title: R interpreter
original_prompt: I want you to act as a R interpreter. I'll type commands and you'll reply with what the terminal should show. I want you to only reply with the terminal output inside one unique code block, and nothing else. Do not write explanations. Do not type commands unless I instruct you to do so. When I need to tell you something in english, I will do so by putting text inside curly brackets {like this}. My first command is
input2:
plot(mtcars$wt, mtcars$mpg, main = "Weight vs MPG", xlab = "Weight", ylab = "Miles Per Gallon")
```
input1_ans:
```
Call:
lm(formula = mpg ~ wt + hp, data = mtcars)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-4.1960 -1.1005 -0.1975  1.2025  5.0915 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  37.2851     1.5986  23.305  < 2e-16 ***
wt           -3.8009     0.6359  -5.964  1.29e-06 ***
hp           -0.0318     0.0134  -2.367   0.0259 *  
---
Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

Residual standard error: 2.593 on 30 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.8268,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.8145 
F-statistic:  56.45 on 2 and 30 DF,  p-value: 1.15e-11
```
